back_cards.definition_en: A story, often fictional or imaginative.
back_cards.example_en: She told a tale about a magical forest.

back_cards.definition_en: A narrative or account of events.
back_cards.example_en: His tale of adventure captivated the kids.
The old tale of the dragon is famous.
Grandpa shared tales from his youth.
That’s quite a tale about your fishing trip!
That concert was absolutely awesome!
The new game is totally awesome.
Her performance was awesome to watch.
The view from the mountain was awesome.
You did an awesome job on this!

back_cards.definition_en: Very large in size or scale.
back_cards.example_en: The giant tree towered over the park.
The story told of a friendly giant.
They built a giant statue downtown.
The company is a giant in tech.
That’s a giant cupcake for the party!

back_cards.definition_en: A long seat for multiple people.
back_cards.example_en: We sat on a bench in the park.
The judge sat at the bench.

back_cards.definition_en: To remove a player from a game.
back_cards.example_en: The coach benched him for the match.

back_cards.definition_en: A worktable for tools or projects.
back_cards.example_en: He built it on his workbench.
She’s on the bench for now.
I need the exact measurements for the shelf.
Her directions were exact and clear.
The boss exacted strict compliance.
The exact time of the meeting is 3 PM.
That’s the exact color I wanted.

back_cards.definition_en: The management of money or funds.
back_cards.example_en: She studied finance in college.
They financed the new car purchase.
Personal finance is important to learn.

back_cards.definition_en: The system of banking and investment.
back_cards.example_en: Finance drives the economy forward.

back_cards.definition_en: Resources or funds for a project.
back_cards.example_en: The project needs more finance.
The advanced technology impressed everyone.

back_cards.definition_en: At a higher level or stage.
back_cards.example_en: She’s taking an advanced math class.
The project is in an advanced stage.
His skills are advanced for his age.
The team advanced to the next round.

back_cards.definition_en: To respond to a situation or event.
back_cards.example_en: She didn’t react to the bad news.

back_cards.definition_en: To act in response to something.
back_cards.example_en: He reacted quickly to the danger.

back_cards.definition_en: To show a response or feeling.
back_cards.example_en: The crowd reacted with cheers.
The chemicals react when mixed.

back_cards.definition_en: To behave in a certain way.
back_cards.example_en: How will she react to the surprise?

back_cards.definition_en: A company or person that publishes books.
back_cards.example_en: The publisher accepted her manuscript.

back_cards.definition_en: One who produces and distributes media.
back_cards.example_en: He works for a major publisher.
The publisher released a new edition.

back_cards.definition_en: A business in the publishing industry.
back_cards.example_en: This publisher specializes in novels.
The publisher promoted the new magazine.
The lake will freeze in winter.

back_cards.definition_en: To become very cold or immobilized.
back_cards.example_en: I froze when I saw the bear.
She froze the leftovers for later.

back_cards.definition_en: To stop or hold in place.
back_cards.example_en: The bank froze his account.
He froze during his speech.

back_cards.definition_en: A change or difference in something.
back_cards.example_en: There’s a variation in the recipe.
This is a variation of the original song.
The variation in results surprised us.
Weather variations affect the crops.
The variation in colors is stunning.

back_cards.definition_en: A metal fastener with a threaded body.
back_cards.example_en: Tighten the screw to secure the shelf.
He screwed the board to the wall.
I really screwed up that presentation.
Give the lid a screw to open it.
They screwed him out of his share.

back_cards.definition_en: The organ in the mouth for tasting.
back_cards.example_en: Her tongue burned from spicy food.

back_cards.definition_en: A language or way of speaking.
back_cards.example_en: English is her native tongue.
The tongue of his sneaker was loose.
He has a sharp tongue when angry.
She stuck out her tongue playfully.

back_cards.definition_en: Vulgar slang for nonsense or junk.
back_cards.example_en: That movie was total crap.
This cheap phone is crap.
Oh crap, I forgot my keys!
His desk is full of crap.
The dog left crap on the lawn.
